definitions.definition: feeling tired and impatient because you have lost interest in somebody/something or because you have nothing to do
definitions.sensetop: bored with/of somebody/somethingbored with/of doing something

examples.text: There was a bored expression on her face.
She plays the role of a bored executive.
He was rather bored with his life in a small town.
The children quickly **got bored** with staying indoors.
examples.contextForm: bored with/of somebody/somethingbored with/of doing something

examples.text: He seemed faintly bored by the whole process.
She was bored with their conversation.
Some children get bored very quickly.
bored at the prospect of going shopping
The others began to look bored.
She enchants an otherwise bored audience.

definitions.definition: to be extremely frightened or bored

examples.text: I remember being bored stiff during my entire time at school.
She enjoys it. Everyone else is bored silly.
He walked along, bored out of his mind.
She was alone all day and bored to death.
You must be bored stiff stuck at home all day.
Personally, I was bored to death.
